work.name: Technology Transformation Services (TTS), U.S. General Services Administration
highlights: Led content strategy and operations for a six-person team
Composed and maintained the Digital.gov product roadmap
Oversaw content migration for Digital.gov transition to Drupal CMS, archiving more than 2,000 pages of redundant or outdated content (52% of total pages)
Supported eight government-wide communities of practice with more than 16,000 members

work.name: School of Government, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
highlights: Established cross-functional teams to support the launch and continuous improvement of digital products and services
Led discovery and delivery for new digital products, including a digital asset management platform, fellowship program site redesign, and statewide impact website

work.name: School of Government, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
highlights: Shaped advancement communications and major gift proposals during the Campaign for Carolina, surpassing the School of Government campaign goal of $50 million

work.name: Robert J. Dole Institute of Politics, University of Kansas
highlights: Oversaw a diverse portfolio of content responsibilities
Assumed leadership of production team and contractors, including budget, procurement, hardware upgrades, and improved accessibility standards

work.name: Department of Intercollegiate Athletics, University of Oklahoma
highlights: Served as primary sport contact for women’s gymnastics (2014 NCAA Champions), soccer, and as local media coordinator for the Women’s College World Series
Created comprehensive annual content plans to increase awareness and attendance for varsity teams
Created social media content strategy for assigned sports, resulting in gains of more than 19,000 followers across all platforms for assigned sports

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

education.studyType: Bachelor of Journalism with highest distinction

publications.name: Expectations vs. reality: Retention challenges and strategies for U.S. state and local government digital services teams
publications.summary: This paper examines the challenges U.S. state and local digital service teams face in retaining talent and offers strategies to improve retention and team stability.

publications.name: Insights Into Hiring for Digital Service Teams
publications.publisher: Beeck Center for Social Impact and Innovation at Georgetown University
publications.summary: A report examining hiring practices, challenges, and lessons learned from U.S. digital service teams.

publications.name: Game-Changer: A Case Study of Social Media Strategy in Big Ten Athletic Departments
publications.summary: This study used a case-study approach to develop an understanding of how social-media strategy is developed and deployed in Big Ten Conference athletic departments.
